triples.name: Unmanned surface vehicle
triples.relevance: ASVs are the primary focus of the paper as autonomous marine vessels for fleet operations.

triples.name: Motion control
triples.relevance: Core control methodology reviewed for coordinated motion of multiple autonomous vehicles.

triples.name: Motion planning
triples.relevance: Key technique for trajectory planning and path-guided control of autonomous vehicles.

triples.name: Collision avoidance system
triples.relevance: Essential for safe multi-vehicle coordination with collision-free path requirements.

triples.name: Formation flying
triples.relevance: Concept applicable to fleet formation control and coordinated motion of multiple vehicles.

triples.name: Autonomous underwater vehicle
triples.relevance: Related autonomous system that the paper suggests for task-region-oriented coordination with ASVs.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Theoretical framework for coordinated control of multiple independent autonomous vehicles.

triples.name: Mathematical optimization
triples.relevance: Foundation for optimization-based coordination methods reviewed for ASV fleet control.

triples.name: Machine learning
triples.relevance: Underlying technology for data-driven coordination approaches identified as future research direction.
